content.description: Starts to the right of 'Hoe Face' // This is an great eliminate problem. The stand starts on a square pinch block and crimp. Move up and left into the top of Hoe Face without using the big juggy pocket in the middle of the face.
content.protection: A couple pads outta do you fine.
content.location: To the right of Hoe Face.

content.description: A left trending extension of Sam and the Dial Tones. Start Sam and work up onto the blunt arete but instead of finishing straight up, move left onto the other gently sloping rail before topping out in the horizontals.
content.location: At the east end of the main corridor just north of the main stairs.

content.description: One of the best at Chandler. Starts at head level on a right crimp and a left block. Cool tension moves will get you standing on the start. Tech it out to get to the horizontal. Backside of the arete is off.
Another pocket line just right of Mono Punks on the same face. Climbs the right side of the face through the block window and uses the larger pockets to gain the horizontal. Top out.
content.location: Just to the right of Sam and the Dial Tones. In the eastside of the main corridor. North-facing.

content.description: Just right of Sam and the Dial Tones is a good face climb with some cool and surprisingly friendly mono pockets. Climb up the left side of the face past the large horizontal jug and through a pair of cute matching monos, one for each hand. Use the remaining pockets to gain the large horizontal and top out.
content.location: Just to the right of Sam and the Dial Tones. In the eastside of the main corridor. North-facing.

content.description: Start on a undercling and a sidepull and step up to match in a horizontal. Move left and up through a crimp and pocket to a high top out.
content.protection: Definitely need a couple pads for the slanted landing.
content.location: This problem is located to the right of Sam and the Dial tones.

content.description: A classic line that despite being an eliminate still maintains a very respected status. Definitely worth climbing. Stand start on a mediocre left pinch and a good right crimp. Make your way up to get your right hand on the hidden hold that made this climb a Chandler classic, a perfect but brutal mono-crimp in the middle of the blank face. Once locked down skip a tempting left hand shallow sidepull pocket, instead using the remaining holds small holds above to gain the horizontal jug. Using the sidepull pocket is Crabs (V5) or a variation of Crabs.
content.location: Just 5 feet left of the arete with Sam and the Dial Tones. Goes straight up the blank face.

content.description: Start on big diagonal left facing flake, get high feet and reach for the 3 finger pocket in the middle of the face. After you stick that, get to the finishing rails. Dirty topout - most people just drop to the pads.
content.location: Just left of "Sam and the Dial Tones"

content.description: A difficult line linking up Herpes and Syphilis/Sam. Starts Herpes with left hand on a mediocre pinch and right hand on a crimp under the mini roof. Move up into the crimp horizontal crack and then comes the brutal crux move. Gain and lock down the mono crimp in the middle of the face with your LEFT hand in order to move up and right to the sloping rail on the face. Top out in the horizontals. Rarely repeated.
content.location: At the east end of the main corridor just north of the main stairs.

content.description: Shaded.  Can be wet and sometimes has crap on it.  This wall sports some harder problems all named after fabulous diseases.  Its great when someone gets a problem and screams "I got herpes!!!"  This is a great wall on Upper Chandler.
